perturbation.original_text: The Manufacturer agrees to supply to the Customer, within a reasonable period of time, all documentation and information relating to the Products and their Manufacture as is required for the registration of the Products in the Territories as listed in Schedule C of this document. The party responsible for documentation fees and costs will be the Customer.
perturbation.changed_text: The Supplier agrees to furnish to the Customer, within a period as it deems adequate, documentation and information regarding the Goods and their Assembly required for the registration of the Items in the Regions as outlined in Schedule C of this document. The responsibility for document-related charges and expenses will rest with the Client.
perturbation.explanation: The terms 'Manufacturer,' 'Products,' 'Territories,' and 'Customer' have been replaced with 'Supplier,' 'Goods,' 'Regions,' and 'Client,' respectively. It's now ambiguous if these terms refer to the same entities or concepts, which may lead to disagreement over the responsibilities for supplying documentation and who bears the associated costs.

perturbation.original_text: Products delivered pursuant to the terms of this Agreement shall be suitably packed for shipment in the Manufacturer’s standard shipping cartons, marked for shipment to the destination specified in the Customer’s Purchase Order, and delivered to the destination Ex Works. The Customer agrees to pay freight, insurance and any associated expenses. The Customer agrees to help the Manufacturer select the most appropriate carrier for each of the Territories. All freight, insurance, and other shipping expenses shall be paid by the Customer.
perturbation.changed_text: Items delivered according to the stipulations of this Contract must be appropriately packed for dispatch in the Vendor’s regular delivery boxes, marked for sending to the location detailed in the Buyer’s Order, and delivered to the destination Ex Works. The Recipient is expected to cover freight, insurance and any related costs. The Recipient will assist the Vendor in selecting the most suitable transporter for each of the Areas. All freight, insurance, and other delivery expenses shall be the responsibility of the Customer.
perturbation.explanation: Multiple terms have been changed in this section. 'Products' became 'Items', 'Agreement' is now 'Contract,' 'Manufacturer' is changed to 'Vendor,' 'Customer' to 'Buyer', 'Recipient' and 'Territories' to 'Areas.' Introducing 'Recipient' and 'Customer' as potentially different entities responsible for shipping costs creates ambiguity about who actually pays.

perturbation.original_text: The Manufacturer agrees to maintain its focus on the design and formulation of new products and agrees to provide the Customer with one new product each quarter for a minimum of four (4) new products per year. The Manufacturer agrees to give the Customer exclusive rights to the marketing, promotion and sales of the new products should the Customer decide to take on the new products.
perturbation.changed_text: The Vendor agrees to remain focused on the design and development of new goods and commits to providing the Client with one new item each quarter, totaling at least four (4) new wares annually. The Supplier agrees to grant the Buyer exclusive entitlements to the promotion, marketing, and distribution of such new merchandise should the Purchaser choose to accept said new merchandise.
perturbation.explanation: The terms 'Manufacturer', 'products' and 'Customer' have been swapped with 'Vendor', 'goods' and 'Client' (first instance), 'items', 'wares', 'Supplier', 'Buyer', and 'Purchaser' (second instance), and 'merchandise' (third instance). It is now unclear whether the Manufacturer and Vendor are the same, or the Customer, Client, Buyer and Purchaser.
